intro: Glomera amboinensis var. buruensis, commonly known as the Buru glomera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant is often found in humid, tropical environments, thriving in shaded undergrowth within dense forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. This variant is distinguished from the typical form by subtle differences in leaf morphology and flower structure.
